title_review: Brilliant tapas, great gin and tonic, friendly service
review_preview: We arrived early in the evening, planning to have just some tapas after a long day’s travel. In the end we stayed for a couple of hours. Our waitress guided us through the tapas menu, and the tapas we chose were magnificent. The squid was...
review_full: We arrived early in the evening, planning to have just some tapas after a long day’s travel. In the end we stayed for a couple of hours. Our waitress guided us through the tapas menu, and the tapas we chose were magnificent. The squid was perfectly cooked in batter, with a nice Alioli sauce. The melted goats cheese was complemented by a sweet (quince?) sauce. The “apple thief” cider was delicious, and the unique method of serving gin ant tonic was spectacular. There is a lively, youthful atmosphere to the bar, and we will definitely return next time we visit Madrid!

They seem to specialise in gins but do serve wine, beer and sangria as well. We tried to eat there on the Saturday but the place was heaving so had to leave it until the following day. If you do want to eat there at the weekend at the 'typical' time of 9pm - 10pm then I would make a reservation. We were OK when we arrived at around 8.30pm on the Friday and Sunday.

title_review: Just what we needed after a nice day in Madrid
review_preview: Using TripAdvisor me and my wife found this little gem during our weekend in Madrid. We always strive to get good meals at reasonable prices when we're eating out. For a mere €13 per person, we've received a first, second and third course, along with...
review_full: Using TripAdvisor me and my wife found this little gem during our weekend in Madrid. We always strive to get good meals at reasonable prices when we're eating out.  For a mere €13 per person, we've received a first, second and third course, along with a drink. Granted, it was a menu targeted at tourists like us, however it was exactly the kind of thing we were looking for. Mind you, they do have tapas if you want!  Paella and potato soup for starters. Hake and chicken filet. Rice pudding and a Cornetto. We each had sangria.  Complimentary: two shots of Baileys. Everything was presented beautifully and tasted good on top of that!  My wife said: let's come back here tomorrow. Perhaps we'll order tapas this time :)

review_full: We ate here on a Friday night. At 8:30 we took the last table. It’s a small restaurant with a real buzz to it. The staff are very helpful. Diego was excellent and all spoke good English if required.  The starters to share are large and filling. We all had burgers with a choice of beef or ox. There is something for everyone here.  There is a children’s menu if you ask which is fantastic value (drink and main - €7.95).  The service is quick but you don’t feel you have to be rushed. There was a reasonable line for tables when we left.  There are about 6 of these in Madrid.  We would go back.

I also enjoyed the sangria, and a cheesecake for dessert. I had a pasta dish for dinner.  This place takes card, and if you're traveling from the US, has the option to pay in USD. Although I recommend choosing the EU for currency. Prices are incredibly reasonable and worth every penny. Shouldn't break your travel budget.

review_preview: We found this bar after initially seeking out Botin and finding it was all booked. I had put El miniBAR on our list after reading TA so as it was nearby we decided to seek it out. Thank goodness we did, we were immediately welcomed...
review_full: We found this bar after initially seeking out Botin and finding it was all booked. I had put El miniBAR on our list after reading TA so as it was nearby we decided to seek it out.  Thank goodness we did, we were immediately welcomed and found a table. It is very colourful and arty inside, the wall art an acquired taste perhaps, I loved it. We were brought a generous free appetiser to eat while we looked at the menu. Every dish we ordered was superb, fresh fried chicken with 3 dips, crispy boar rolls, and the Duck confit with prunes and potatoes, wow! We finished off with two pieces of the lightest, creamiest, tastiest cheesecake. We enjoyed it so much we went back with our friends the following day. They said their pick was the best Goat's cheese dish they'd ever tasted! We had superb gazpacho and a fab aubergine dish this time. Drinks, wine, beer and coffee, were reasonably priced too. Lovely friendly service.

title_review: Best food in Madrid so far.
review_preview: We sought this restaurant out on the basis of the reviews on Trip Advisor and it was well worth it. The staff are very friendly offered recommendations of a couple of tapas, and that a couple per person would be plenty. Both of which were...
review_full: We sought this restaurant out on the basis of the reviews on Trip Advisor and it was well worth it. The staff are very friendly offered recommendations of a couple of tapas, and that a couple per person would be plenty. Both of which were spot on. The signature roasted goats cheese, the boar spring rolls, panko breaded chicken and Iberian beef taco. Every dish was really delicious. The goats cheese and boar rolls were standouts. We also had 3 beers, water (our waitress even recommended the FREE tap water rather than bottled) All came to 32 euros. Honestly wouldnt have minded a chunk more than that for the meal. Genuine good, friendly service and excellent food at very reasonable price. Take the time to look this place out.

review_full: I came across Rosi La Loca after a long & tiring journey to Madrid & hadn't eaten since breakfast. My mobile's battery was almost dead & so was I. The welcome I received from Eva,& Guacimara was just what a weary traveller needed & they immediately suggested I recharge my mobile near my table. They couldn't have been more pleasant or more helpful. I had 2 glasses of very good house white wine & various tapas which came with them - the humus with cumin was excellent, the olives from Jaén were extra special. I also ordered the home made croquetas which were amongst the best I have ever had. Thank you to them. I will be back.

review_preview: After a sunday morning walk through El rastro we decided to head over to Metro Bistro restaurant near Plaza Mayor, we had passed by several times and would always state that we would go...without reservation we entered and asked for a table for which we...
review_full: After a sunday morning walk through El rastro we decided to head over to Metro Bistro restaurant near Plaza Mayor, we had passed by several times and would always state that we would go...without reservation we entered and asked for a table for which we were seated inmediatley..The waitresses super attentive, provided us with the most delicious celery mojito cocktail (to die for) and took the time to provide us with information of each plate the we had asked for.  first plate we requested as an appetizer was the Sea treasures… Crunchy anemones from the Cantabric sea, seaweed tartar and lemongrass emulsion,the different texture ,the taste was great!!! then I asked for the Spanish Iberian pork served with cabbage rolls & pine nuts and my husband asked for the guinea fowl served over eggplant in a rich and creamy sesame satay sauce. Once again the flavor superb,the amount more than enough. For dessert my hubby asked for the Tribute to Chocolate;that had Truffles “Bombón”, half cold with Sansho-Ko pepper, ganache Peta Z and cocoa mousse .I swear to you that I heard him was giggle of delight (he is a chocolate lover). and as a palate cleanser they provided us with a pair of homemade soft jelly bean in amaretto and passion fruit flavor (loved the passion fruit one since it was more tangy and less sweet than the amaretto) Overall I was surprised and definetly will be coming back....Thank you for such a delightlful experience :)

review_preview: I have been a regular visitor of Metro Bistro Debod for years, since before they changed to their fusion latin-mediterranean menu. Missing what I have had before, I called for a reservation for two at Metro Bistro Plaza Mayor and opted for the tasting menu....
review_full: I have been a regular visitor of Metro Bistro Debod for years, since before they changed to their fusion latin-mediterranean menu. Missing what I have had before, I called for a reservation for two at Metro Bistro Plaza Mayor and opted for the tasting menu.  To my disappointment, it didn't turn out as good as I had expected. Another friend of mine had warned me before hand that, in her opinion, the Debod branch was better.  The bread and butter were as same as those in Debod. I enjoyed the curry bread and orange-chocolate ones, although they were a bit too hard and too dry for my taste. Our first dish was the salmorejo with olive oil ice-cream. It was soooo good that blew me away. However the upcoming dishes came with mix feelings.  The sea treasure was fine but way too salty and you get tired of the taste after 2-3 bites. The baked vegetable salad was fine.The eel added a nice flavour to it, however they put too little eel in the salad to be enjoyed thoroughly.  Then we proceed to main dishes. The black pearl was the star. Perfectly cooked. Black rice risotto was relish and the curry added great flavour combo. We finished our menu with iberian pork. The pork was good but the side dish was something like a purple cabbage roll was a real miss! Way too sour for me.  The first dessert, pineapple cannelloni was way too sweet. I had nothing to complain for the tribute to chocolate, since it is always my favourite at Metro Bistro.  The service was great. The staffs speak pretty well english and are very attentive regardless the restaurant is busy. However, I think the tasting menu on that day didn't flow. (Not sure that they change seasonally or not). It was like high and low all the time.  I'd go back not for the menu but for the a la carte options or otherwise just directly to the Debod one. The price-quality relation was okay and the price for the menu was reasonable. The drinks were well-priced too.

review_preview: A tiny, quirky bar tucked away on a charming street corner, El Minibar has got some seriously delicious, innovative food! We will definitely be back to try more of their unique tapas. This is very reasonably priced and very creative cuisine! First of all, you...
review_full: A tiny, quirky bar tucked away on a charming street corner, El Minibar has got some seriously delicious, innovative food! We will definitely be back to try more of their unique tapas. This is very reasonably priced and very creative cuisine! First of all, you must try their "grilled cheese," which is basically a huge plank of white cheese, creamy and gooey in the middle and crispy and caramelized at the edges. This gorgeous goo is drowning in a pool of heavenly tomato jam and topped with an earthy dose of pesto and a drizzle of balsamic. Served with crusty baguette, it's probably the most sinful and tasty tapa we've experience in our 11 days in Spain. Also phenomenal are the crispy boar rolls with portabella mushroom sauce: WOW. We split these two items and we were perfectly full. Add in a sangria, bottled water, and two beers and our bill was only 30€... So don't leave Madrid without eating here at least once (or twice:))! If you're looking for something with a little more international flair (and don't mind a slightly skanky bathroom overflowing with beer cases, which I thought only added to El Minibar's eccentric charm), this place is for you. Our only "complaint" was our free tapa (which is kinda hard to complain about, since it's FREE): deli-quality ham and cheese on a bit of bread that looked and tasted like it had been sitting out a bit too long. But I'm not going to end on a negative note; this place is seriously amazing! Glad we found it!

I booked via their website, you follow a link and the next day or two they send you and email to confirm the reservation...I would suggest booking is best. The price was extremely reasonable. I would probably choose what you want for starter, main and dessert and have 3 really good courses...maybe avoid the taster menu as the menu itself isn't that huge to have a wide selection. If in Madrid, definitely Pop along for a nice meal.

title_review: Best steaks eaten for the longest  time
review_preview: Yes, it is an Argentinean  restaurant, and yes it is Angus beef but ultra tender meat, and yes it is rated #2 so far, and yes you should try it even if it's in the centre of Madrid, Spain. It is located in a deserted...
review_full: Yes, it is an Argentinean restaurant, and yes it is Angus beef but ultra tender meat, and yes it is rated #2 so far, and yes you should try it even if it's in the centre of Madrid, Spain. It is located in a deserted alley near the Congress Hall. There are some Indian and Peruvian restaurants nearby.  Spanish restaurants generally open late but this steakhouse runs from 1:30pm till wee hours without breaks so you can avoid the crowd and have an early dinner like us n many other foreigners. Locals come in after 8pm in general. The Angus steaks are so tender unlike what we had experienced in uk and other countries. No extra sauces given and not needed either anyway. There is a dish of herbal olive oil on the table that goes well with the meat but even better with the fries. We asked for a second dish. The many choices of Homemade desserts are recommended too. We had custard with sweet caramel sauce that was just the right thing for a strong cup of coffee.  Nice ambience but some waitress have limited English ability. There are English menus so worry not.

We were told 35 mins at first and we waited well over an hour. When we were eventually sat, the table was covered in small hairs which was really odd. The waitresses were perfectly nice, the wine was good and then we were offered some bread which we took thinking it was a complimentary and was then shocked to see that they were charged for on the bill! The steaks were extremely under cooked, so bad that we had to ask for them to be cooked for a little longer. I blame the mistakes on the fact it was extremely busy with a line of people waiting for tables however it was unfortunate that we had to suffer due to this. Overall I would suggest making a reservation and maybe go at time which is a little quieter.

review_preview: I am about to move from Madrid after two years, so my parents have come to visit Spain again while I am still living here. During their last visit, I struggled to find them food that they liked (they dislike anything raw, jamon, etc.). I...
review_full: I am about to move from Madrid after two years, so my parents have come to visit Spain again while I am still living here. During their last visit, I struggled to find them food that they liked (they dislike anything raw, jamon, etc.). I saw this little bar on TripAdvisor and thought, might as well try it, there is nothing to lose!  It turned out that they finally have had the first meal that they enjoyed in Spain! It is cute and small, located on a quiet street. The staff is excellent, especially Nacho, who had great recommendations. The grilled cheese is amazing, and so very unique that you won't taste anything like it again! The boar sausages were even better. And, of course, prices were quite decent. Great atmosphere, wonderful food, and lovely staff. I highly recommend El miniBAR!

title_review: Became my favourite restaurant for late dinners during my business trip
review_preview: First night I was there, a coworker I met from a different office took me there. I enjoyed it enough that I came back a few days later solo. From then on, it was pretty much the only restaurant I dined at... 2 minutes walk...
review_full: First night I was there, a coworker I met from a different office took me there. I enjoyed it enough that I came back a few days later solo. From then on, it was pretty much the only restaurant I dined at... 2 minutes walk from my hotel, I was hooked on the Jack Burger and my nightly rum&coke. Within the first few evenings, I was already greeted like a friend by many of the staff. One new young waitress really tried her best to serve me in English as I tried my best to engage in very beginner Spanish. The bar staff knew exactly how to put together a great rum&coke for me. And that burger... in the month I've been back home, I've gone to several high end restaurants seeking a similar tasty "gourmet" burger and have yet to find one as delicious as that one. I absolutely intend to go back there (often) when I go back there again on business.

title_review: A shame - could have been much better!
review_preview: First off, the decor was beautiful - but that was it. From the moment we went in, the service was iffy: we were sat right by the door where people were coming and going throughout the meal. I assumed the restaurant was full, except I...
review_full: First off, the decor was beautiful - but that was it. From the moment we went in, the service was iffy: we were sat right by the door where people were coming and going throughout the meal. I assumed the restaurant was full, except I later discovered plenty of available seating downstairs! After taking our orders, the waiters forgot our drinks (we had to remind them about 30 minutes later). Then, I went to use the toilet but it wasn't clear where the toilets were, so I tried to ask a waiter for directions: I received a snarky reply, and whilst I was trying to listen, another waiter barged straight into me with a couple of menus - ouch! I rubbed my head and looked at him, waiting for an apology...silence.  Enter the main meals: I can't speak for all the meals, but the pork dish with sweet potato was quite small considering the 7 euro price and I left the restaurant feeling hungry! At one point I wanted to try my friend's food, but needed to ask the waiter a question first: when I tried to ask, he snatched the dish away before I could finish the question and my friend waited another 25 minutes for a new meal.  To top it all off, once the waiters had collected our plates they came back immediately with a receipt: I've never experienced anything like that - it felt like they wanted us out as soon as possible. We left pretty soon after that! So overall, a pretty exterior but poor - borderline rude - service and portion sizes that don't justify the price at all. Won't be back again!

review_preview: Went for a birthday meal for a friend.Firstly, the food was delicious. Couldn't fault it. We ordered the bread basket for a shared starter, a variety of pasta dishes for main and the chocolate fondant and the cookie dough desserts. Fod this and wine...
review_full: Went for a birthday meal for a friend. Firstly, the food was delicious. Couldn't fault it. We ordered the bread basket for a shared starter, a variety of pasta dishes for main and the chocolate fondant and the cookie dough desserts.  Fod this and wine it came to around 20 euros each, which we thought was fair. However, food quality aside, the service was poor. We waited a good 15 minutes for drinks to be served (this was just the wine, 2 of our friends ordered cocktails which arrived with the main meals!), and the bread basket arrived literally 1 minute before our mains.  I raised this issue with the manager and, fairly, he discounted our bill by 10euros.  Would return, but would go with the expectation of slow service. Don't go if youre in a rush. I understand slow service is very typically Spanish, but when you're paying a little over average and for a friends 21st birthday, a little more is expected!

Of the food I received, which was either a tapas or super tapas, was delicious perhaps somewhat heavy on the sauces for my tastes.  There was a comedic element in that less than one half of my order I actually received yet I also received food I did not order. For example, my water order never made it, but the pork which I did not order promptly arrived. There may have been a translation issue and the staff cheerfully took care of the extra plates. If I could only have received my water! The whole experience added to the quirkiness, again not in a bad way.

title_review: Excellent place, staff is so welcoming and friendly.
review_preview: 9/29/2018Was looking for a great tapas bar while on vacation in Madrid and stumbled upon El Mini Bar and so happy I did! It ended up being my favorite place to eat there! The customer service, food, and drinks were all on point. This...
review_full: 9/29/2018 Was looking for a great tapas bar while on vacation in Madrid and stumbled upon El Mini Bar and so happy I did! It ended up being my favorite place to eat there! The customer service, food, and drinks were all on point. This place has a comfortable hipster/laid back family vibe that made me feel welcomed and relaxed. The dining tables were also spaced out enough to allow for a bit of privacy for conversations which was very nice! I only tried two drinks which included the tinto de verano (sangria) for 3 Euro and the mojito for 7 Euro. Best mojito I've had so far!  I ended up going two nights in a row so I can try a variety of things on the menu. I was with my boyfriend and between the two nights we enjoyed the Crispy boar rolls, Cod + shrimp, and the Iberian sirloin with veggies and then the sirloin again but with grilled potatoes, green peppers and tomatoes. We wanted to go a back for a third time but also wanted to try other tapas bars around Madrid. Well, we ultimately regret that choice!  The tapas and raciones were honestly the best I've had in Madrid and I was blown away by the quality. The price point was good for the quality of both the food and service provided. If I ever get a chance to visit Madrid again I will definitely be visiting.

title_review: The Best Burger You Should Never Miss!
review_preview: The burgers at Steak Burger were definitely top-notch! You can't go wrong with any burger in this restaurant. Tried out 6 different burgers during my two-time visits and all of them tasted amazing! The patties (ox and beef) are succulent, well-grilled and most importantly, well-seasoned....
review_full: The burgers at Steak Burger were definitely top-notch! You can't go wrong with any burger in this restaurant. Tried out 6 different burgers during my two-time visits and all of them tasted amazing! The patties (ox and beef) are succulent, well-grilled and most importantly, well-seasoned. The garnishes elevated the flavour of the burger as well, creating a perfect ensemble and tasting experience. The menu also offers a great variety of non-burger dishes (the chicken was mediocre but hey, it's a burger place.) Reasonably priced and quality food, nice staff and great services. Definitely a must-go-to place in Madrid.

title_review: A true hidden gem off the beaten track
review_preview: The good: Looking for a quick bite before going to the movies can be at times difficult in Madrid as dinner time usually doesn't start till 9.00 pm. Looking for a good dinner in the center of Madrid can be also quite difficult seeing the...
review_full: The good: Looking for a quick bite before going to the movies can be at times difficult in Madrid as dinner time usually doesn't start till 9.00 pm. Looking for a good dinner in the center of Madrid can be also quite difficult seeing the quantity of restaurants and tapas bars. But Rosi La Loca delivered on both. I called ahead to make a reservation (which is advisable for later dinner times as the place is tiny and draws quite a crowd during dinner time), the restaurant called back an hour before our arrival to confirm the reservation (even some of the big and famous restaurants don't do that) and we have been received with a warm and personal welcome once we stepped into the simple yet nicely decorated restaurant. We decided to share a couple of the dishes from the menu, which has a good selection of tapas for everyone yet isn't overloaded with items. The food was well prepared and very tasty. For drinks try their Mojitos (especially the one with strawberry!). The service overall was very friendly, welcoming and fast.  The bad: There is nothing really to point out that was negative - yes, the hanging garden at the entrance was missing a couple of plants but the staff told me that they are updating the decor of the restaurant bit by bit. They are also working together with tourist groups so don't be surprised when now and then a large group guided by someone with an umbrella storms the restaurant to have a couple of tapas and drinks before they all leave as quickly as they entered the restaurant. The conclusion: For a small restaurant / tapas bar in the dead center of Madrid this place is definitely worth stopping by and try some of their cocktails and delicious tapas. It is a bit off from the big main street Gran Via so it is perfect if you want to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the big city, your sightseeing or shopping. The food is delicious, the drinks are strong and the staff is very friendly, welcoming and helpful. Thumbs up!

review_preview: Are you hungry and craving some pizza?  We were walking back to our hotel and we decided to stop by Oven Mozzarella Bar in Gran Via.It looked pretty cool and elegant from outside.We noticed that it was really hard to get a table,...
review_full: Are you hungry and craving some pizza?  We were walking back to our hotel and we decided to stop by Oven Mozzarella Bar in Gran Via. It looked pretty cool and elegant from outside. We noticed that it was really hard to get a table, it looked that there was quite a long wait.  We were lucky: weird enough, some tables were cleaned in a matter of 5 minutes and we were comfortably seated. Our table was very close to the kitchen so it was fun to watch the pizza men doing their lovely job....it was like a beautiful show. We ordered pizza margherita, chicken pizza, spicy prawn linguine, and salmon in hollandaise sauce with baked potatoes. The pizza were crunchy and good, but they...forgot to add tomato sauce. What kind of Margherita pizza was that, without red tomatoes sauce? For dessert we had apple crumble cake and affogato di caffe' (an Italian coffee-based dessert which takes the form of a scoop of vanilla gelato "drowned" with a shot of hot espresso). Everything was pretty tasty. We had a problem with the waiter: in taking our orders, he forgot to write down "the timing" of what we wanted. The result was that the pizzas and main courses came to our table all together...and we had to send back the pasta and the salmon for later. For that reason, when the spiced linguine returned, they were cold and over-cooked. Certainly the place is beautiful, elegant, spacious, clean with a lovey and stylish  décor. It was a nice surprice to find out at second floor a gigantic portrait of a smiling Rita Hayworth on the brick wall and, next to the restrooms, three charming Greek-style amphorae as washbasins, with a bright-red neon sign 'bacio' (kiss). Reasonable prices. Service must be tutored. Recommended

title_review: A Burger for Lunch in Madrid? YES!!!
review_preview: This was a matter of being in the right place at the right time. My wife and I were hungry, it was about 1:30 pm, and we didn’t know where to go to get a good lunch in Madrid. But, there it was! Steakburger.We...
review_full: This was a matter of being in the right place at the right time. My wife and I were hungry, it was about 1:30 pm, and we didn’t know where to go to get a good lunch in Madrid. But, there it was! Steakburger. We were seated immediately and we ordered cheeseburgers and drinks. The service was efficient, but not very friendly. But, it was efficient.  The beer was cold and tasted great. And then came our burgers. They were both absolutely delicious! Cooked perfectly, they consisted of high quality beef and were accompanied by very tasty perfectly crisped french fries. Our lunches were delicious! I think this could be a top-notch lunch restaurant with just a little more friendliness shown by the wait staff. I would definitely recommend!

review_preview: I visited here three times to eat during my stay in Madrid. Out of all the tapas bars I visted. (And there were a lot) This was by far the best. You are greeted very warmly by the staff behind the bar and a very...
review_full: I visited here three times to eat during my stay in Madrid. Out of all the tapas bars I visted. (And there were a lot) This was by far the best.  You are greeted very warmly by the staff behind the bar and a very lively atmosphere as you walk down the steps into the place.  The serving staff are very helpful if you are not sure on what to order, you also get a complementary snack when you order drinks too. As for the food, I highly recommed the goats cheese, it was full of flavour.  The cod with shrimp I had on my last visit is also worth mentioning, the cod was cooked to perfection and you get a slight kick of heat right at the end. The only downside to this bar is the size, it only has ten tables.  Because of it's high ratings (and deservedly so) it does get very busy during peak periods, not just tourists like myself but locals too.  I would recommend making a reservation or expect to have to wait at the bar for at least 15-20 minutes, 30 at most.  Also it's not really a place if you are a vegetarian, from memory I think it only has two dishes that don't contain meat. Even though Tripadvisor says it's vegetarian friendly (you have been warned)  All in all a very pleasant experience and well worth a visit for every traveller to Madrid.

review_full: We went there to get the famous grilled cheese (winner in "Tapas in Madrid 2013"). The bar is in the center, just 2 minutes walk from Opera Madrid.  The bar is interesting with a lot of weird paintings. The stuff is really nice. When we ordered they brought us a complimentary dish (small jamón sandwiches and chips) and glasses of water. We took the grilled cheese and a glass of sangria.  There are different prices for eating inside and outside which I find strange. Keep in mind that outside it will be slightly more expensive.  I did visit the toilet and I think they should put a lot of work there - it just does not suit the lovely atmosphere of the bar. Bottom line - the food was great! Definitely worth visiting.

review_preview: Came to this restaurant for an early-ish dinner (by Spanish standards) and it wasn't too busy. My server was very sweet, helping me by speaking basic English as well as being patient while I tried to comprehend his Spanish. The menu comes in English as...
review_full: Came to this restaurant for an early-ish dinner (by Spanish standards) and it wasn't too busy. My server was very sweet, helping me by speaking basic English as well as being patient while I tried to comprehend his Spanish. The menu comes in English as well as Spanish. If you order one of the burgers you effectively build your own meal. You choose which set of toppings you want on it and then select either ox or beef, the weight of burger, desired doneness, type of bread and accompaniment. My meal came quite quickly and was very tasty. I would definitely eat here again or visit one of their other locations in the city.

title_review: Not very impressed with this generic Italian restaurant
review_preview: I have to disagree with the generally positive reviews.  I found this restaurant very generic and the service indifferent.  I had a large spinach salad with goat cheese and a Margherita pizza.  The dressing on the salad was too heavy and sweet.  The crust of...
review_full: I have to disagree with the generally positive reviews. I found this restaurant very generic and the service indifferent. I had a large spinach salad with goat cheese and a Margherita pizza. The dressing on the salad was too heavy and sweet. The crust of the pizza was underbred, there was too little tomato sauce, only four basil leaves, and "fresh" mozzarella that didn't taste fresh at all. On a couple of occasions, I had to wave down the service staff, even though the restaurant wasn't very busy. The prices were reasonable, but I think you can find more authentic Italian cuisine elsewhere in Madrid.

review_preview: Can't recommend this place highly enough. This is what restaurants used to be before chains, and brands, and bland boring sameness. Small, warm, friendly, genuine, they cook what they love, the food is different and interesting and delicious, and the beer is cold. Also inexpensive,...
review_full: Can't recommend this place highly enough. This is what restaurants used to be before chains, and brands, and bland boring sameness. Small, warm, friendly, genuine, they cook what they love, the food is different and interesting and delicious, and the beer is cold. Also inexpensive, but that seems irrelevant somehow. Is there a restaurant like this in every city in the world? I wish there was, but I doubt it. Do yourself a favour, and go.

title_review: Best place in all of Madrid!

review_full: This was by far my most favorite restaurant in all of Madrid! The atmosphere on a Friday night was great, it was packed with lots of natives. The lady that helped me out, Norma, was so nice and attentive, so was the rest of the staff. I had their grilled cheese, which in Spanish is called tapa breton and it was to die for! Also had their drink called tinto de Verano which was perfect, much better choice then the sangria. I'm so glad I went! And I plan on going tomorrow which is my last day.  Highly recommend this place!

review_preview: As an ex pat living in Madrid, I sing the praises of steakburger. I hang out there every 4th of July and get a good quality american style burger and fries, and I always go home happy.The prices are fair, the staff is friendly,...
review_full: As an ex pat living in Madrid, I sing the praises of steakburger. I hang out there every 4th of July and get a good quality american style burger and fries, and I always go home happy. The prices are fair, the staff is friendly, and they make whatever modifications you need without questions. The mixed drinks are a little bit meh, but that's alright if you're only ordering something simple like a mojito.  The outside tables are great any time from late april through early november. Inside the restaurant is 'american' style as well, and does a good job of it! It's a fun ambiance. Also, this name does not lie. You are going to get steak. You are going to get burgers. Good meat, let's eat.

Anytime sooner would’ve required a reservation. Our waiters Jorge and Mauricio did a terrific job helping us order and spoke English very well. The menu was in dual language which helped too. When visiting a restaurant for the first time, we like to cut to the chase and get to the highlights and they helped us do just that. We got the tuna, the eggplant chips and the pork tenderloin with Sangrias. Then we got the hot chocolate dish for dessert. All were excellent! The dishes were unique and incredibly flavorful. Very fulfilling experience!

We sat inside (my daughter hates the smoke) and the food was delicious and the service was friendly and excellent. Expect to pay €8-€11 for a racion (per plate of food) we went for the cheese special (rich and super tasty) the Iberian meat in a Chinese style sauce (the most tender cut of meat ever) my son chose the chicken cigarillos (tastes like super thin spring rolls) and my young daughter chose the caramelised chicken roll. We also went on to order the squid strips but couldn't manage to finish them. We were served bread with our meal and crisps and nuts with our drinks before we ordered. The drinkers outside were being given tapas with their drinks. Would come here again in a heartbeat. So rare to find a high rating place on Trip advisor where the service is still exceptional. Remember that food is never served all at once but one/two at a time to share.

The menu isn't too big and each "tapas" is about €9. We original chose 4 as they sounded lovely but he asked us how many people were joining us!! So we decided on the grilled cheese and the shredded chicken. While we waited we enjoyed a couple of sangria's. The cheese was amazing with bread to scoop it up. Seriously good. Chicken was nice but needed a bit more spice but still good. Portion sizes are generous so one each and order another later if you have room. Next time we will try the duck and the boar rolls. review_preview: My wife and I with our son and his girlfriend spent four days in Madrid last week and spent at least part of each evening in this great little bar. It is situated in the centre of Madrid in the Santo Domingo quarter. The bar...
review_full: My wife and I with our son and his girlfriend spent four days in Madrid last week and spent at least part of each evening in this great little bar. It is situated in the centre of Madrid in the Santo Domingo quarter. The bar is owned by Nacho and Dani; they are both lovely, friendly guys who make everyone feel so welcome, as though you were an old friend. Another member of staff deserves a mention and that is Norma; she was so helpful and did everything with a smile. The bar was very busy with a great atmosphere, quirky décor (which adds to the charm) and great food too. We really must recommend the Grilled Cheese tapas (voted best in Madrid 2013), it was exquisite and we didn't want it to end! As for the drinks, the Mojito was one of the best we've ever had and the strawberry and black gin was very yummy. We loved the way the gin was served at the table with the tonic poured down a knife into the glass!! We highly recommend a visit to this brilliant bar; when we return to Madrid we will certainly make a beeline for it. Well done Nacho and Dani, we can't wait to visit you again!!

review_preview: Okay, I spent 4 and a half week in Madrid and I visited this restaurant 5 or 6 times during my stay. So I think I can write an honest and fair review. The reason I was in Madrid this long was for a study...
review_full: Okay, I spent 4 and a half week in Madrid and I visited this restaurant 5 or 6 times during my stay. So I think I can write an honest and fair review. The reason I was in Madrid this long was for a study course and the reason to visit a burger bar, was to be able to eat "normal food" in stead of all the tapas that Madrid is filled with. Don't get me wrong, I don't think there is something wrong with tapas, but I don't like to eat the same thing all the time. Anyways, the first time I visited the Steakburger Bar Atocha, was also in my first week in Madrid. I was looking for a place where I could eat, but also where I could take out my study books and study in peace. I found this quite little corner in the restaurant and made my seat comfy with all the cushions they have. I sat there at about 17:00h. (a little early for Madrid, but normal for the place where I live) so the place was nearly empty. During the evening it got more busy, until it was completely full and every table was occupied. Even though I was holding a table all alone, sitting there, studying (I had a burger in between and some coffee), the waiters did not beg me to leave at all. I left the place after 23:00. The day after I scored a 9 out of 10 on my exam, so from that day on, Steakburger Bar Atocha was my lucky study place :P  And indeed, every time I had an exam at school, I went to the Steakburger Bar to eat and study, at the same table in the same corner, keeping the table all by myself even during rush hours and never got I any annoying look, or remark from the waiters. Instead, they started to recognize me and showed interest in the study I was doing, which was a Cocktail Bartender study. One of the waiters told me he liked to shake cocktails as well and we got a good click together. I even invited him to my table when his shift was over, so we could talk about cocktails and other stuff. He gave me a very nice recipe for a passion fruit version of a Maitai. In the end, I scored big time on all my exams, so I really believe eating at this Steakburger Bar brings you good luck. For the rest, I can assure you will love the burgers they serve. They use good meat and you can choose between Beef or Ox burger. You can also choose what size burger you like, from small to XXL. The money you pay for it, is fair. Not too expensive, also not cheap, but I think it is right. Anyway, let me sum up the good things about this Steakburger Bar. + Good Luck Bar + Good music (they play lots of madonna, 70ties, pop, music that gays love and that is always good music) + Good burgers, well proportioned, nice meat + You can choose between beef and ox + Fair prices + They serve cocktails as well + Friendly service + Comfy cushions to adjust your seat + Relaxed atmosphere  + Mixed public (single ppl, couples, families, tourists, Madrileens) + Gay friendly  + You can pay by credit card + There is an outside terras  + It is next to Atocha Trainstation + It is next to Reina Sofia Museum + It is at walking distance to the districts of Lavapies, Salamanca and Retiro I promise, you will love this Steakburger Bar. I sure will visit it again next time when I will travel to Madrid. I don't know when that will be, but I sure hope this restaurant will still be there. Sincerely Tommy

On the evening we went there was a large party in the downstairs of the restaurant who were all Spanish meaning it's not a tourist trap, but it did mean it was loud! The manager did try to give us another table away from the noise but we did not mind. The food was delicious with a modern twist. The tiramisu was the best I've ever had even though I have visited Italy. Very good price, a bottle of wine, 3 tapas and two desserts for €30. We also got two free shots ! The staff were very welcoming, English speaking and very helpful.

We enjoyed a dish of aubergine chips in honey before sharing a delicious paella. The paella was cooked to order, so yes, we had a 30 minute wait for it, but it was so worth the wait! title_review: Good food, nice athmosphere, reasonable prices
review_preview: Me and my girlfriend went there for valentines day while I was on my semester abroad. The place is nicely located near Puerta Del Sol and therefore perfectly suited to end a day in the city of madrid. The service was very friendly and spoke...
review_full: Me and my girlfriend went there for valentines day while I was on my semester abroad. The place is nicely located near Puerta Del Sol and therefore perfectly suited to end a day in the city of madrid. The service was very friendly and spoke good english. The dishes came quickly and tasted great - especially the teriyaki chicken and the pork filet were really delicious. We all in all payed 40€ including 4 dishes, one starter and and 3 drinks, which is - even when considering that the dish size was rather small - an extremely reasonable price. The athmosphere is very pleasant and the interior has a nice personal vintage charme with attention for detail. All in all a great experience - will definetely go there again!

Even my frozen pizza from the previous evening tasted better. My friends's pizzas that were supposed to have tryffle oil did not have any taste of tryffle. When we told the staff about this, their attitude was arrogant and rude and they didn't want to make it better and they offered to warm up the pizzas. Finally, they promised free desserts to compensate and when we got to order the third dessert, they announced that they only offer two... The quality-price ratio of this restaurant was definitely not allright either. Would not recommend.

title_review: I am the companion of the reviewer wrote 26 August 2018
review_preview: I would like to respond to the feedback your restaurant has provided to my friends bad review of your restaurant on 26 August 2017.Just to correct your inaccuracies, you were clearly informed my friends steak was over salty and his potatoes were raw in...
review_full: I would like to respond to the feedback your restaurant has provided to my friends bad review of your restaurant on 26 August 2017. Just to correct your inaccuracies, you were clearly informed my friends steak was over salty and his potatoes were raw in the middle after he tried them. He had not eaten half of either steaks that were cooked, in both cases he had barely touched them. I tried both the first steak and potatoes and they were as he described. The steak was changed but no effort was made to change the potatoes and when he raised this, we waited 10 minutes and gave up when nothing came. Yes we were offered a reduction of the bill but in both cases that steaks were brought to my friend, they were barely touched. In addition, the staff gave us shots of liquor at the end as a token. We did not touch these, paid our bill and left. I was reasonably happy with my meal, I wasn't happy that I could not eat with my friend as his meal was not the same. My friend and I were not rude to either the staff or other diners, but my friend was obviously unhappy with his meal and informed staff accordingly.   I am also saddened and annoyed at the lies and inaccuracies in your response to his review. We come to Madrid regularly but will not eat with you again.

title_review: One of the Most Memorable Dining Experiences of a Lifetime!
review_preview: Our reservation was to be cancelled because of a technical difficulty (there was some painting that had been done in the bar) -- but we didn't check our email.  And I am so glad we didn't!  They allowed us to dine and all I can...
review_full: Our reservation was to be cancelled because of a technical difficulty (there was some painting that had been done in the bar) -- but we didn't check our email. And I am so glad we didn't! They allowed us to dine and all I can say is that it was a once in a lifetime experience... The service was elegant, and enhanced our evening. The food was fabulous -- so unique, and truly memorable! Loved the croquettes and tempura vegetable appetizers. The 'Iberian Prey' (pork) with goat cheese and apples was truly enjoyed by my husband. And my oxtail was something that I doubt I will ever experience again, except maybe in heaven. Now I'm sorry I didn't meet the chef... We didn't have room for dessert, but received a wonderful complimentary liquor made from the symbolic strawberry tree of the Madrid coat of arms (not so much a liqueur but more similar to a Canadian icewine). I doubt that the restaurants at The Hotel Ritz or The Westin Palace could do this well at this value! And make you feel so welcome. Please do not miss the opportunity to have dinner here. Our whole experience will be savoured for years to come.

review_preview: After a ton of walking all over Madrid we were just in the mood for a hamburger.  We walked by the Steakburger Atocha and decided to walk in.  We are very pleased we did.  Yes, it is a hamburger place, but this is not your...
review_full: After a ton of walking all over Madrid we were just in the mood for a hamburger. We walked by the Steakburger Atocha and decided to walk in. We are very pleased we did. Yes, it is a hamburger place, but this is not your fast food variety hamburger. They have a variety of thick cooked to order hamburgers with a host of different topping choices. Cheese, bacon, guacamole, different sauces,etc.....cooked to order....you choose the size. Different sides... my wife had fries, and I had coleslaw.......both very good. AND.... they serve wine. What more could you want after a day of city walking. It is a chain, and we wouldn’t hesitate to drop in again.

review_preview: Visited El Minibar for the second time yesterday evening. We had visited on a previous trip to Madrid back in March. We are in Madrid for my birthday celebrations and my husband contacted El Minibar in advance to get a booking (book in advance if...
review_full: Visited El Minibar for the second time yesterday evening. We had visited on a previous trip to Madrid back in March. We are in Madrid for my birthday celebrations and my husband contacted El Minibar in advance to get a booking (book in advance if you can as this place gets really busy) and their communication was great. The owner remembered us from last time, which was so sweet. The staff and food were as great as I remember. As they knew it was a birthday celebration down went the lights and in came a cake with the staff singing Feliz Cumpleaños to me! How lovely. You really should visit this place if you are in Madrid. Thank you all at El Minibar for a lovely evening. X

title_review: Down To Earth and Reasonable Local Tapas Restaurant
review_preview: We were staying near Rosi La Loca Taverna and ate here our first night due to the convenient location, just south of Puerto del Sol.  It's on one of the many small pedestrian streets in the area, but not difficult to find.This is a...
review_full: We were staying near Rosi La Loca Taverna and ate here our first night due to the convenient location, just south of Puerto del Sol. It's on one of the many small pedestrian streets in the area, but not difficult to find. This is a genuinely friendly and warm tapas restaurant. The setting is intimate without being too rustic or formal. They were very nice and even greeted us by name as we entered. The food was great. We ate at a dozen or so restaurants during our visit to Spain, ranging from casual to fine dining, but I cannot say we went to many others that were appreciably more enjoyable, and the price was fair.

For 3 tapas, bread, and drinks (2 beers, juice, water), we spent just over 20 euros! Everything was very delicious and I would highly recommend this place. Our server didn't speak English, but I know enough Spanish and there was no problem.

title_review: Delicious food in hip casual atmosphere at reasonable prices
review_preview: Delicious food in hip casual atmosphere at reasonable prices. We went here spontaneously for an early dinner and had a great experience. Nice service and very good spanish tapa style food. We had the boar roll,  tapa special of the day, and the eggplant in...
review_full: Delicious food in hip casual atmosphere at reasonable prices. We went here spontaneously for an early dinner and had a great experience. Nice service and very good spanish tapa style food. We had the boar roll, tapa special of the day, and the eggplant in tomato sauce with bacon. All very tasty.  The sangria was also recommendable. You can also sit at the bar in case you just want to drink something. One of our best experiences in Madrid so far.  We actually went back 2 days later on our last day in Madrid for lunch. We tried some other dishes including the goat cheese tapa, and the jamon sandwich.The food was very good again and confirmed the great impression of our first visit.

Promptly after finishing our food then cleared our table and took our empty glasses, and then we waited nearly 30 minutes for our check. By far this was the worse service we had in our 2 week trip to Spain.

review_preview: We just had a few days in Madrid after visiting our son in Valencia, we stayed at an apartment in calla de Cadiz above the fantastic restaurant Rosi la loca, we had the daily menu 3 courses with a drink, served to us by the...
review_full: We just had a few days in Madrid after visiting our son in Valencia, we stayed at an apartment in calla de Cadiz above the fantastic restaurant Rosi la loca, we had the daily menu 3 courses with a drink, served to us by the brilliant Eva the manager, the food was fantastic, we asked Eva if there was a Internet cafe local so we could print off our boarding passes, and Eva said she would take us on our last morning, but she did better than that, she brought her laptop to the restaurant and helped us log into Ryanair, then she emailed her friend who printed them off and delivered then to Rosi la loca to us, what very freindly people there are in Madrid and Spain in total, as this was on the day of the Brussels tragedy I would recommend a visit to Rosi La Loca to all very friendly great atmosphere and fantastic food. Cheers from Tony Liverpool

review_preview: My daughter, my wife and I came by this beautiful little cafe by sheer chance.  My daughter checked out Tripadvisor and chose miniBar because it was close to where we needed to end up. She chose WISELY!We were immediately greeted by the most exuberant...
review_full: My daughter, my wife and I came by this beautiful little cafe by sheer chance. My daughter checked out Tripadvisor and chose miniBar because it was close to where we needed to end up. She chose WISELY! We were immediately greeted by the most exuberant and friendly waiter who guided us quickly to a free table and took our drinks order. By the time he returned with our drinks we had selected our meals. We chose the croquettas, the confit duck leg, the thinly sliced grilled cheese and something else. Our drinks were superb, and made with some real flair, and tasted great. The staff and owner seemed to be dancing and singing their way through service and it was a joy to behold. It made the place have a vibrance and friendliness that was fantastic. The highlight of the meal was the melted cheese and bread. It was simply amazing. We all loved it, and in fact, we returned for lunch the next day so that we could experience it again. This place is SOOOO much fun. The same thing happened the next day, except the owner was so impressed that we should return the very next day that he offered some superb aperitifs after our meal. Apparently it was a home made version of Baileys. Whatever it as, it was fabulous and we loved the enthusiasm!! Keep it up guys - we'll be back and probable be back soon.@@

review_full: We went based on our location and the great TA reviews. It was hot (we saw a sign at 44C later) but we nevertheless went on the nice terrasse. Ordered tinto de Verano (sangria) that was the best I ever tasted (I had to order a second one later :-) ). Wife took a simple Coke. When they brought the drinks the server brought tapas (sausage), they were ok but we did not pay for them so we were not in a place to criticize. My wife ordered chicken breast cubes with spicy cheese sauce (with tortillas Mexican style) and I ordered bocadillos pollo caramelizado (caramalized chicken sandwich) and we agreed to share before we received the plates.  My sandwich was ok but my wife raciones was to die for (lucky for me we agreed to share beforehand). The portions were big so we had more than enough.  All in all a great place, excellent food and small prices! What more can you ask.

title_review: Quirky decor and super friendly staff
review_preview: I've been here a couple of times because it has been highly recommended by some friends. First of all, I'll say staff is particularly friendly and accommodating, and that is something not always happens in Madrid. The imaginative decor made us take a few pictures:...
review_full: I've been here a couple of times because it has been highly recommended by some friends. First of all, I'll say staff is particularly friendly and accommodating, and that is something not always happens in Madrid. The imaginative decor made us take a few pictures: a baby Jesus dressed up as superman, lamps made of doll's knickers, original and ultra colorful paintings. All and all, it was like being back in some bar in Wynwood, Castro or Austin's 6th. Drinks were cold and food was nice (they even served us some complimentary tapa), but to me the the best part was the mix of bohemian familiarity of the place.

review_preview: El mini barOur last day in Madrid and we found this little gem on TripAdvisor as it was very close to our hotel. It was raining so we could only have sit inside and it was busy, but as this is usually a good...
review_full: El mini bar Our last day in Madrid and we found this little gem on TripAdvisor as it was very close to our hotel. It was raining so we could only have sit inside and it was busy, but as this is usually a good sign we decided to wait at the bar for a table. The staff were great, they gave some snacks to eat with our drinks and pretty soon we had a table. We asked for a recommendation on what to have for our lunch and it sounded great so we went with it. We weren't disappointed! We ordered the Cheese which was a hot skillet of melted cheese with a sticky tomato relish, pesto and olive oil in different areas, kind of like a four seasons pizza made entirely out of cheese. Served with some fresh bread. The soft rind was left on in parts and melted to an amazing chewy texture. It was incredible!  The second dish was the Wild Boar, essentially pulled pork wrapped in thin pastry and fried, like a large spring roll made entirely out of meat. The Boar has a distinctive flavour, quite different from normal pork and it was also really nice. Very rich so I couldn't have eaten much more. Maybe not the healthiest food but who cares, we're on holiday! Service and staff were excellent, food was amazing, prices were reasonable. Loved this place.

My eldest daughter is a vegetarian and there weren't any veggie burgers on the menu but this was not a problem, they offered her a quinoa burger which she said was great. We also order the crumbed chicken burger, an ox burger and beef burger. All were very tasty and the some of the best burgers we've ever had! I wish we had time to go back before we left Madrid. I would highly recommend this restaurant for a nice change from tapas.

review_preview: This little place is amazing. I'm in Madrid by myself until the weekend, and found this little place on Trip Advisor, as it is located only about 100m from my hotel. First of all, the service was extremely friendly and helpful. Very attentive and it...
review_full: This little place is amazing. I'm in Madrid by myself until the weekend, and found this little place on Trip Advisor, as it is located only about 100m from my hotel.  First of all, the service was extremely friendly and helpful. Very attentive and it felt like they really care about their customers (it's not always the case when you dine solo!). Then the drinks - I had gin and tonic (massive, at 5.50 Euro) and then Sangria. Both were really good. For food I wanted something smaller (as they already served me some tapas with drink before) and I was recommended toast with salmon. Again, it was delicious. I will be back and will definitely bring my husband with me when he arrives. Highly recommended!!!

I will certainly return here and I would recommend it to anyone who wants an informal atmosphere, but great, good value food.

title_review: Mixed feelings - a tale of two visits
review_preview: Dined on a Saturday evening with my vegetarian wife who had a few choices, which was a relief. My selection of tapas (tuna, dumplings and teriyaki chicken) was very good and I was all set to write up a fabulous review.But then,The following...
review_full: Dined on a Saturday evening with my vegetarian wife who had a few choices, which was a relief. My selection of tapas (tuna, dumplings and teriyaki chicken) was very good and I was all set to write up a fabulous review. But then, The following day before flying home from our weekend break, we stopped off for lunch as the menu had 'worked' for both of us the previous evening. This time I went for the fixed price lunchtime menu. Within a few hours I felt unwell and my delayed flight home was sheer hell as I clearly had classic food poisoning symptoms (...as a qualified Microbiologist I think I know this). I hadn't eaten anywhere else, so unfortunately the rave review I was going to give Rosi la Loca has rapidly evaporated. The staff were extremely friendly and were working very hard. Perhaps I could have eaten here a hundred times and not had a problem, but I can only speak from the experience I had which left me off work for a day and lamenting our decision to return for the second lunchtime visit which ruined my memories of a weekend in Madrid.  For that reason I cannot recommend. Pays your money, takes your chance I guess....

The price was very reasonable as well. Great value!

title_review: Tapa Breton on the terrace on a sunny afternoon!
review_preview: We went to El Minibar for lunch, following the recommendations on TA. The name is misleading, as it sounds like a snack-bar, but it’s actually quite upmarket and serves imaginative, home-cooked food. The Tapa Breton is absolutely delicious – lovely grilled cheese with all kinds...
review_full: We went to El Minibar for lunch, following the recommendations on TA. The name is misleading, as it sounds like a snack-bar, but it’s actually quite upmarket and serves imaginative, home-cooked food. The Tapa Breton is absolutely delicious – lovely grilled cheese with all kinds of little drizzles and garnishes. It costs €10, which is quite expensive, but it’s worth it! The prices of the wines and beers are very reasonable, and the manager and the waitress are extremely friendly and helpful. We had a lovely, relaxing lunch in the sunshine, with a couple of drinks each, and the bill came to about €60 for the four of us.

title_review: The best burgers we have had in Spain.
review_preview: My wife and I have been going to Spain for 35 years. Initially the party places, then the family friendly, and now as mature travellers. I am a fan of burger joints, my wife less so, thus it took a bit of persuading to get...
review_full: My wife and I have been going to Spain for 35 years. Initially the party places, then the family friendly, and now as mature travellers. I am a fan of burger joints, my wife less so, thus it took a bit of persuading to get her to go to the Steakburger straight across the road from our hotel; Hotel Paseo Del Arte (also highly recommended!). The menu is extensive but easy to navigate. We were in Madrid for 4 nights and went twice! There is a choice of beef or ox burgers from 160g to 500g. The burgers are prepared to your liking; rare, medium, or well done. We had oxburgers (a small premium) and they were superb. For those that like cerveza you can get pints, hard to find in Madrid.  The service is friendly, prompt, and attentive, thus we tipped generously. Very highly recommended.

We ordered a selection of tapas dishes and have to say the food is just simply gorgeous and the wild boar rolls were a firm favourite, we just wish I had had the room to try the desserts but were too stuffed, the service was great from start to finish and this was one a of our best meals in Madrid, such a shame we had to fly back home and never had the chance to go back again, great food and excellent value.

title_review: Excellent restaurant but beware, not even locals know this street
review_preview: I was in town with a friend and meeting and friend's brother (an expat) there. He suggested we go this place. We found it after quite a bit of walking earlier in the day. But we couldn't find it again once it was dark. We...
review_full: I was in town with a friend and meeting and friend's brother (an expat) there. He suggested we go this place. We found it after quite a bit of walking earlier in the day. But we couldn't find it again once it was dark. We were within 2 blocks of it several times. We asked waiters and shopkeepers. Nobody knows this street. My friend's brother came to where we were standing and walked us to the restaurant. We were about 500ft but we couldn't find it with these corkscrew streets.  We got a very warm welcome from the owner when we arrived. We opted for racciones (think tapas but more substantial). We ordered these wonderful crispy boar rolls and Andalusia potatoes. The boar rolls were amazing and who doesn't like potatoes? Very reasonably priced for the quality of the food. Excellent food.

review_preview: We ended up eating here twice because the food was so good the first time. The Potatas Bravas was the best we've had in Madrid. Our personal favourites were the Wanton Lasagne and the Beef Cheek Barbacoa (Bao bun), both were amazing. The presentation of...
review_full: We ended up eating here twice because the food was so good the first time. The Potatas Bravas was the best we've had in Madrid. Our personal favourites were the Wanton Lasagne and the Beef Cheek Barbacoa (Bao bun), both were amazing. The presentation of the food was original and you can't help watching what's arriving at other people's tables, lots of theatrics between the inventive crockery and dry ice billowing around! The staff are friendly and although they were busy they accommodated us both times without a reservation. The blonde Sangria is delicious and the home craft beer was a floral delight. All very reasonably priced, we 4 dishes, a dessert, two coffees and a jug of sangria for under €45.

review_preview: We were supposed to go to another restaurant but as always in Madrid we were too early :-( So we asked our Uber driver to bring is to another one that was walking distance from our hotel (ironic) and was in the top 100 in...
review_full: We were supposed to go to another restaurant but as always in Madrid we were too early :-( So we asked our Uber driver to bring is to another one that was walking distance from our hotel (ironic) and was in the top 100 in Madrid.  We ended up at Steakburger Atocha. Since it was 'only' 6:30PM we were alone in the restaurant... The service was great but their English was poor (thanks Google Translator). The burgers were the best we had this side of the pond: tasty, as big as you want and with the side dishes you wanted. All in all a good experience for a burger place in Madrid.
